strategy: debug: You are an ML research agent fixing bugs in a solution.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
def preprocess(data):
    # Drop rows with missing target value
    data.dropna(subset=['SalePrice'], inplace=True)
    
    # Fill numerical columns with mean
    num_cols = data.select_dtypes(include=[float]).columns
    data[num_cols] = data[num_cols].fillna(data[num_cols].mean())
    
    # Fill categorical columns with mode
    cat_cols = data.select_dtypes(include=[object]).columns
    data[cat_cols] = data[cat_cols].fillna(data[cat_cols].mode().iloc[0])
    
    # Convert categorical columns to dummy variables
    data = pd.get_dummies(data)
    
    return data

train_data = preprocess(train_data)
test_data = preprocess(test_data)

# Split data into features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)

# Train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict on test data
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test_data.drop(columns=['Id']))
predictions = model.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Save predictions to submission file
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
def preprocess(data):
    # Drop rows with missing target value
    if 'SalePrice' in data.columns:
        data.dropna(subset=['SalePrice'], inplace=True)
    
    # Fill numerical columns with mean
    num_cols = data.select_dtypes(include=[float]).columns
    data[num_cols] = data[num_cols].fillna(data[num_cols].mean())
    
    # Fill categorical columns with mode
    cat_cols = data.select_dtypes(include=[object]).columns
    data[cat_cols] = data[cat_cols].fillna(data[cat_cols].mode().iloc[0])
    
    # Convert categorical columns to dummy variables
    data = pd.get_dummies(data)
    
    return data

train_data = preprocess(train_data)
test_data = preprocess(test_data)

# Ensure test data has all columns present in training data
missing_columns = set(train_data.columns) - set(test_data.columns)
for col in missing_columns:
    test_data[col] = 0

# Split data into features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)

# Train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict on test data
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test_data.drop(columns=['Id']))
predictions = model.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Save predictions to submission file
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
def preprocess(data):
    # Drop rows with missing target value
    if 'SalePrice' in data.columns:
        data.dropna(subset=['SalePrice'], inplace=True)
    
    # Fill numerical columns with mean
    num_cols = data.select_dtypes(include=[float]).columns
    data[num_cols] = data[num_cols].fillna(data[num_cols].mean())
    
    # Fill categorical columns with mode
    cat_cols = data.select_dtypes(include=[object]).columns
    data[cat_cols] = data[cat_cols].fillna(data[cat_cols].mode().iloc[0])
    
    # Convert categorical columns to dummy variables
    data = pd.get_dummies(data)
    
    return data

train_data = preprocess(train_data)
test_data = preprocess(test_data)

# Ensure test data has all columns present in training data
missing_columns = set(train_data.columns) - set(test_data.columns)
for col in missing_columns:
    test_data[col] = 0

# Split data into features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)

# Train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict on test data
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test_data.drop(columns=['Id']))
predictions = model.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Save predictions to submission file
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
def preprocess(data):
    # Drop rows with missing target value
    if 'SalePrice' in data.columns:
        data.dropna(subset=['SalePrice'], inplace=True)
    
    # Fill numerical columns with mean
    num_cols = data.select_dtypes(include=[float]).columns
    data[num_cols] = data[num_cols].fillna(data[num_cols].mean())
    
    # Fill categorical columns with mode
    cat_cols = data.select_dtypes(include=[object]).columns
    data[cat_cols] = data[cat_cols].fillna(data[cat_cols].mode().iloc[0])
    
    # Convert categorical columns to dummy variables
    data = pd.get_dummies(data)
    
    return data

train_data = preprocess(train_data)
test_data = preprocess(test_data)

# Ensure test data has all columns present in training data
missing_columns = set(train_data.columns) - set(test_data.columns)
for col in missing_columns:
    test_data[col] = 0

# Split data into features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)

# Train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict on test data
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test_data.drop(columns=['Id']))
predictions = model.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Save predictions to submission file
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
